meanings.definition: It is necessary or proper for someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: It behooves you to study for the exam.
meanings.sent2: It always behooves us to listen to our elders' advice.
meanings.sent3: It would behoove the cat to chase the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: In order to succeed, it behooves you to take risks.
meanings.sent5: Remember, it behooves us to be kind to one another.

meanings.definition: It is appropriate or advantageous for someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: Wearing a coat would behoove you in this cold weather.
meanings.sent2: It is always behooving to be polite and respectful.
meanings.sent3: It might behoove the plant to be watered more often.
meanings.sent4: In negotiations, it behooves you to be well-prepared.
meanings.sent5: It is behooving to always strive for improvement.
